ai.summary: A 6.3 km moderate loop around Brechin town, UK. The route blends town streets with green spaces and riverside sections, offering a relaxed day hike with gentle slopes and seasonal views of historic sights.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly paved sidewalks and park paths with occasional gravel sections. Generally smooth, with a few uneven patches on older streets and grassy edges; expect mild gradients in places.
ai.safety_notes: General safety: check forecast and daylight; wear sturdy footwear and weather-appropriate clothing; be mindful of traffic on shared streets; stay on marked paths and watch for uneven surfaces; bring water and some snacks; carry a small map or phone with offline navigation; tell someone your plan; in winter and wet conditions, surfaces can be slippery; use sun protection in sunny weather.
recommended_gear: Map or offline navigation (phone or paper map)
ai.best_seasons: Spring, summer, and autumn are ideal; winter can be windy and wet, so plan accordingly.
